SEARCH

Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
The `InputHandler` class provides utility methods for handling user input. It includes methods for obtaining integer, string, and yes/no inputs, with optional validation and custom prompts.

    • closeScanner

      public static void closeScanner()
      Closes the shared Scanner instance. This should only be called once, typically at the end of the program.

    • getIntInput

      public static int getIntInput(int min, int max)
      Gets an integer input from the user within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      min - Minimum value allowed
      max - Maximum value allowed
      Returns:
      A validated integer input

    • getIntInput

      public static int getIntInput(String prompt, int min, int max)
      Gets an integer input from the user within a specified range with a custom prompt.
      Parameters:
      prompt - Message to display to the user
      min - Minimum value allowed
      max - Maximum value allowed
      Returns:
      A validated integer input

    • getStringInput

      public static String getStringInput(String prompt)
      Gets a string input from the user with a prompt. Ensures the input is not empty.
      Parameters:
      prompt - Message to display to the user
      Returns:
      A non-empty string input

    • getStringInput

      public static String getStringInput(String prompt, Predicate<String> validator, String errorMessage)
      Gets a string input with a custom validator.
      Parameters:
      prompt - Message to display to the user
      validator - A function to validate the input
      errorMessage - Message to display when validation fails
      Returns:
      A validated string input

    • getYesNoInput

      public static boolean getYesNoInput(String prompt)
      Gets a yes/no input from the user.
      Parameters:
      prompt - Message to display to the user
      Returns:
      true for yes, false for no
